content: I don't have personal opinions or emotions. however, i can tell you that hiking to the base camp is a worthwhile trip, and you don't need specialized mountaineering equipment, skills, or experience to do so. the base camp is located at the lower saddle of grand teton, which is around 11,600 feet in elevation. the hike to the base camp takes an average of 6-10 hours and requires a good level of fitness, determination, and proper equipment. you will need sturdy hiking boots, appropriate clothing and gear, food and water, map and compass, and knowledge of basic wilderness skills. while you won't have the experience of standing on the summit of the grand teton itself, hiking to the base camp offers stunning views of the teton range and a rewarding experience in the high mountain wilderness.
